text:
“My name is Yorgos Lanthimos,
and I’m the director
of “The Favourite.’”
[clanging]

“So this is the place
where Abigail and Sarah,

the characters that
Emma and Rachel play,

it’s a spot that they
meet more than once.

And you kind of get to
watch the progression
of their relationship.

Emma and Rachel were trained
how to use these guns,

so they spent a few
hours with an instructor.

He showed them how
to operate them

and to make sure that
everything was safe,

because Rachel had to load
one of them during the take.

And so we rehearsed
and

made sure that everything
worked out fine.”

“Even if I were the last one
left in this wretched place,
I would remain a lady.”

“"[laughing] you’re
pretty when outraged.

So my secrets are
safe with you?”
“All of them.”
“Good.”
“Even your biggest secret.”

“It’s a dangerous scene,
but it’s also quite funny,
as well.”
“Abigail?”
[gunshot]
[gasping]

“There’s a lot of insinuations
and sharp dialogue.

And there’s a surprise
within this scene.

So it combines
all these elements

that I think are
representative of the film.”

“Sometimes it is hard to
remember whether you have
loaded the pellet or not.

I do fear confusion,
and accidents.”

“I’m sure people
will be careful.”
